H0.text: Nuclear is the kind of change that occurs in wood when it burns in a campfire, releases heat, and becomes ash.

H1.text: Magnetic is the kind of change that occurs in the wood as it burns and releases heat.

H2.text: Chemical change occurs in the wood when it burns and releases heat, turning it into ash in a campfire.

H3.text: Mechanical is the type of change that occurs in wood when it burns and releases heat, turning it into ash in a campfire.

A4.text: Combustion reactions frequently involve a hydrocarbon.

A5.text: Chemical reactions are usually characterized by a chemical change, and they yield one or more products, which usually have properties different from the reactants.
